article_text: The Chinese-led Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank, with 57 members and $100 billion in committed capital, is challenging the current regime, as it looks to focus on infrastructure and speed up project approval. It is taking aim at a long entrenched system, which developed out of the Bretton Woods conference at the end of World War II.
